intro: Hieracium remissiceps, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium remissiceps is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
